intro: Silene maeotica, commonly known as the Crimean catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the steppes of the Caucasus and southern Russia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 20–40 centimeters. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and slightly hairy, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Silene maeotica is often found in open habitats such as meadows and along riverbanks.
